page.title: 19Farming
page.content: Most of our block is farmland. In this area there used to be lots of dairy farms but there are not quite so many now because of the 'milk quota' system which has been introduced. We studied two farms in particular, {Limekilns}and{Spittalriddinghill.} Limekilns is a farm of about 375 acres (150 hectares) with 20 fields. This year 3 are barley, 3 silage, 2 hay and i each for potatoes and kale. The rest are grass for sheep and cattle grazing. The animals kept are 2 bulls, cows, calves, sheep and lambs for breeding. All bull calves are sold. As the name of the farm suggests there were in the past lime pits in this area. Some of the buildings where the lime was treated are still in existence.
